numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Some applicants are non-legacy applicants.
2. Some applicants are legacy applicants.
3. Some applicants have wealthy parents.
4. Some applicants have poor parents.
5. Some applicants have alumni parents.
6. Some applicants have non-alumni parents.
7. Non-legacy applicants with wealthy parents are less likely to be accepted than non-legacy applicants with poor parents.
8. Applicants with wealthy alumni parents are most likely to be accepted into the university.
9. In some cases, the admissions rate of wealthy alumni applicants increases.
10. Where the admissions rate of wealthy alumni applicants increases, the admissions rate of wealthy non-alumni applicants decreases.
11. I wonder why these students apply to the university.
12. I wonder what reasoning these students have for their applications.
13. My mother is an alumna of Michigan State University.
14. My father is an alumnus of Michigan State University.
15. I grew up going to the campus of Michigan State University.
16. I love the campus of Michigan State University.
17. I do not necessarily want to go to Michigan State University.
18. Some people want me to go to Michigan State University because of my parents.
19. Some people expect me to go to Michigan State University because of my parents.
20. I wonder what pressure legacy applicants have.
21. Perhaps Ivy League universities favor legacy applicants.
22. I wonder whether many legacy applicants apply because they are legacy applicants.
23. The title is "A Legacy of Parental Pressure".
